answered.question: What matters most in the conventions cleanup?
answered.answer: All of the above: Model conventions, Controller patterns, Dead code removal

answered.question: How should we handle convention violations that would change public API behavior?
answered.answer: Fix everything -- rename/restructure even if it changes method signatures or route patterns

inferred: User wants comprehensive cleanup, not surface-level
Public API changes are acceptable for convention alignment
Tests should be updated to match any changes, not removed
All layers: models, controllers, services, dead code
Generator should be maximally helpful -- create files rather than just warn
Target Rails 8 defaults (queue.yml) rather than supporting legacy naming
